channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Review: Chilling Adventures of Sabrina ends run with disappointing finale
item.description: Even the best episode of the series can’t save S4 from a sloppy, muddled final season

item.title: A curious observer’s guide to quantum mechanics, pt. 2: The particle melting pot
item.description: In which lasers do things that make absolutely no sense but give us great clocks.

item.title: AI-powered text from this program could fool the government
item.description: Volunteers couldn’t tell AI-generated comments from those penned by humans.

item.title: After a decade, NASA’s big rocket fails its first real test
item.description: “It’s not everything we hoped it would be.”

item.title: What motivates the motivated reasoning of pro-Trump conspiracists?
item.description: New study suggests a desire to see society focus on men helps drive support.

item.title: The local politics of AirBNB’s ban on DC rentals
item.description: Traumatized residents, city officials fear a repeat of January 6 insurrection.

item.title: Hackers alter stolen regulatory data to sow mistrust in COVID-19 vaccine
item.description: Post titled “Astonishing fraud! Evil Pfffizer! Fake vaccines!” found on the Dark Web.

item.title: With Trump’s vaccine rollout in chaos, Biden unveils five-point plan
item.description: “We will manage the hell out of this operation,” Biden vowed.

item.title: Wandavision premieres in ways that would never work on ABC—and that’s great
item.description: Disney+ take on Marvel TV is a massive zag from Netflix’s zig—and we’re intrigued.

item.title: Report: Xbox’s “instant on” feature could consume 4 billion kWh by 2025 [Updated]
item.description: NRDC: Series S/X option will result in 3 million tons of CO2 in five years.

item.title: As it turns out, the Biden administration will listen to scientists
item.description: “Science will always be at the forefront of my administration."

item.title: FDA blindsided as Trump Admin cripples agency on its way out
item.description: It’s “a full-frontal assault on public health," one official said.

item.title: FCC fines white-supremacist robocaller $10 million for faking caller ID
item.description: Robocaller’s fake caller ID numbers were allegedly chosen as neo-Nazi symbols.

item.title: Facebook will pay more than $300 each to 1.6M Illinois users in settlement
item.description: It’s a far cry from the maximum $35B Facebook might have owed, but not nothing.

item.title: Trump team modernizes car safety regulations for the driverless era
item.description: Auto safety advocates blast the lack of new safety regulations.

item.title: A big wing and no back seats: The 2021 Mini John Cooper Works GP
item.description: It’s a bit like driving a supercar, warts and all.

item.title: How law enforcement gets around your smartphone’s encryption
item.description: Openings provided by iOS and Android security are there for those with the right tools.

item.title: Report: New MacBook Pro models will arrive this year with MagSafe, M1 successor [Updated]
item.description: Apple is also considering dropping the Touch Bar.

item.title: US declares Xiaomi a “Communist Chinese military company,” bans investments
item.description: Xiaomi won’t suffer the suffocating supply chain bans of Huawei—at least, not yet.

item.title: There is no COVID vaccine reserve. Trump admin already shipped it
item.description: “This is a deception on a national scale.”

item.title: Trump tries to claw back billions from COVID vaccine distributor
item.description: The cuts have no chance of passing but are likely to further enrage health experts.

item.title: This painted pig is the world’s oldest figurative art
item.description: The pig’s spiky head crest and two facial warts helped identify its species.

item.title: Toyota fined $180 million for 10 years of noncompliance with EPA regs
item.description: There have been “systematic, longstanding violations” of reporting rules.

item.title: The NSA warns enterprises to beware of third-party DNS resolvers
item.description: Yes, plaintext DNS is insane, but encrypting it has its own tradeoffs.

item.title: NASA gives up on taking Mars’ temperature
item.description: Meant to drive a heat sensor 3 meters deep into Mars, it only managed 3 centimeters.

item.title: The rise and fall (and rise again) of retro car design
item.description: “The PT Cruiser gets hammered by a lot of people… You know, we sold 1.3M of those.”

item.title: Rocket Report: NASA dishes on small rockets, Jeff buys a ride on a Falcon 9
item.description: “AR1 is the ideal engine for many possible solutions.”

item.title: US grid will see 80 percent of its new capacity go emission-free
item.description: Plans also call for the first new nuclear plant in years.

item.title: AMD claims new Ryzen 5000 mobile CPUs best Intel for gaming, content creation
item.description: The new H-series chips are for gamers, while the U-series is made for ultraportables.

item.title: Craft brewers now have a new tool for sniffing out trace flavor compounds
item.description: Thiols impart a pleasant fruity aroma, but they can be difficult to track and measure.

item.title: Google says it’s closing the Fitbit acquisition—uh, without DOJ approval?
item.description: Google doesn’t have DOJ approval, but it says it has waited long enough.

item.title: Ex-Michigan governor indicted for “willful neglect” in Flint water crisis
item.description: Public officials “evaded accountability for far too long,” prosecutor says.

item.title: Today’s best tech deals: iPad Air, indoor security cameras, and more
item.description: Dealmaster also covers gaming headsets, robot vacuums, and lots of video games.

item.title: 2020 ties 2016 as the warmest year on record
item.description: Despite conditions that favored cooling, we’ve never recorded higher temps.

item.title: Scientists stuck as China keeps foiling WHO investigation on virus origin
item.description: Two scientists are stuck in Singapore as the rest of the WHO team finally makes it to Wuhan.

item.title: Facebook knew about violent extremists before insurrection, reports find [Updated]
item.description: Facebook COO downplayed company’s role in the insurrection; reports show otherwise.

item.title: PC sales finally saw big growth in 2020 after years of steady decline
item.description: Lenovo led in market share, but Apple and Acer grew the most compared to 2019.

item.title: Nintendo uses copyright claims to take down Game & Watch hacking videos
item.description: User’s other hacking videos remain up without footage of Nintendo’s own games.

item.title: Despite COVID-19 lockdowns, American roads are getting much deadlier
item.description: Empty roads mean more speeding, more crashing, and more dying.

item.title: Parler CEO admits site may never recover from Amazon ban
item.description: Later in the same interview he says, “Parler will return” but doesn’t know when.

item.title: The Galaxy S21 is official, gets an across-the-board $200 price drop
item.description: You get the Snapdragon 888, dynamic refresh rates, and bigger fingerprint readers.

item.title: Tesla’s touchscreen trouble: NHTSA asks for recall of Models S and X
item.description: After more than 500 complaints, Tesla will now have to fix this safety defect.

item.title: SpaceX hot fire tests its Starship vehicle three times in four hours
item.description: “Today at SpaceX is about practicing Starship engine starts.”

item.title: CDPR CEO blames “in-game streaming” for Cyberpunk’s console problems
item.description: Native next-gen versions pushed back to second half of 2021 amid patching work.

item.title: Filing: Amazon warned Parler for months about “more than 100” violent threats
item.description: Parler’s volunteer mods allegedly had a backlog of more than 26,000 posts.

item.title: Hackers used 4 zero-days to infect Windows and Android devices
item.description: Boobytrapped websites are used by attackers to infect people who visited them.

item.title: AT&T kills off the failed TV service formerly known as DirecTV Now
item.description: AT�T TV Now folded into AT�T TV, which finally gets a no-contract option.

item.title: The Acura TLX Advance hits the luxury notes, misses the sporting ones
item.description: The sedan is now bigger—and a big improvement on the previous generation.

item.title: Qualcomm will acquire chip company founded by Apple execs for $1.4 billion
item.description: Tech will be used in laptops, phones, cars, and more.

item.title: Nvidia’s next laptop GPU generation powers a leap to 1440p displays
item.description: CES-timed announcements beat AMD to the latest mobile-generation upgrade.

item.title: Dire wolves aren’t wolves at all—they form a distinct lineage with jackals
item.description: The extinct canids had been isolated from wolves for 3 million years.

item.title: Tesla’s main self-driving rival isn’t Google—it’s Intel’s Mobileye
item.description: Mobileye CEO predicts Tesla’s Autopilot strategy will hit a “glass ceiling.”

item.title: After white supremacists storm US capitol, Apple expands racial justice initiative
item.description: New centers in Atlanta, Detroit focus on opportunities for black technologists.

item.title: Airbnb cancels all DC-area reservations ahead of Biden inauguration
item.description: Airbnb is worried that “armed militias and known hate groups” may return to DC.

item.title: After corporate blunders and setbacks, Intel ousts CEO Bob Swan
item.description: Embattled US chip giant makes move just days before strategy update.

item.title: Samsung’s next Exynos SoC will have an AMD GPU
item.description: Samsung says the fruits of its partnership with AMD should appear next year.

item.title: EA’s hold over Star Wars games ends with Ubisoft’s open-world announcement [Updated]
item.description: The Division developer Massive Entertainment will work on the still-mysterious title.

item.title: YouTube suspends Trump’s account, disables comments “indefinitely”
item.description: YouTube was one of the last mainstream social channels still hosting Trump.

item.title: Move over, ARM: BeagleV is a $150 RISC-V computer designed to run Linux
item.description: BeagleV is an affordable way to get your feet wet with RISC-V Linux computing.

item.title: Owen Wilson must choose between real and fantasy worlds in Bliss trailer
item.description: Director Mike Cahill also made award-winning 2011 sci-fi film Another Earth.

item.title: N95 masks, gamer style: Razer’s crazy face-mask prototype revealed
item.description: CES prototype may be vaporware, but high-end features have us intrigued.
